title: Add allow-by-default lints for all attributes with unsafe behaviors

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: T-lang
labels.description: Relevant to the language team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
In #72188, an allow-by-default lint was added against `#[no_mangle]`, which previously permitted unsafety even in the event that `#![forbid(unsafe_code)]` was used.

I think it'd be a good idea to collect a list of all such "unsafe attributes" and try to add similar lints for them on a case-by-case basis. This shouldn't be terribly difficult to do by extracting them from the [Built-in attributes index from the Rust Reference](https://doc.rust-lang.org/reference/attributes.html#built-in-attributes-index).

I've started a list below. Please leave comments and I'll update it (or anyone else who has the power to do so, feel free). Items in the list with ~~strikethrough~~ are deemed out-of-scope.

## ABI, linking, symbols, and FFI

- [ ] `link`
- [x] ~~[`link_args`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/29596)~~ (see #29596)
- [x] ~~`link_name`~~ (see [this comment](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/82499#issuecomment-785412847))
- [x] ~~`repr`~~ (see [this comment](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/82499#issuecomment-785415172))
- [x] `export_name` (#72188, #72209)
- [x] `link_section` (#97086)
- [x] `no_mangle` (#72188, #72209)
- [x] ~~`used`~~ (see [this comment](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/82499#issuecomment-785418613))

## Others?

Please leave comments with suggestions or corrections.
